items.title: In the smouldering wreckage of the Coalition, rumours are running rife
items.description: Dissecting the implosion of the Coalition and figuring out what comes next has become a full-time vocation for the newly emancipated Liberals and Nationals.

items.title: 'Insulting': Starmer demands apology after Trump's slur against NATO troops
items.description: Donald Trump criticised NATO during a Fox News interview on Thursday, saying the US had "never needed" the alliance.

items.title: Trump forces Europe to reconsider its security and economic future
items.description: As the world's elite gathered in Davos, European leaders confronted a reality in which they might need to defend themselves, and potentially against, the United States.

items.title: How Australian Neo-Nazis covertly signal their views
items.description: Viking symbols and a Norwegian jacket have now become synonymous with Australia's Neo-Nazi groups, but what do they mean?

items.title: ICE observers are trying to fight back after child was snatched in Minnesota
items.description: Reverend Ashley Horan lives one block from where Renee Good was shot and killed and by ICE agents. She and her neighbours have been tracking ICE's movements around Minneapolis.

items.title: Heatwave and fire warnings across south-east Australia as tropical cyclone hits WA
items.description: Parts of south-east Australia are bracing for severe heatwaves and fire warnings over the long weekend, as the Bureau of Meteorology issues a tropical cyclone warning for Western Australia.

items.title: John Williamson takes his final bow at Tamworth Country Music Festival
items.description: Aussie music legend John Williamson will take the Tamworth Country Music Festival stage for the last time as he steps into retirement.

items.title: The storm after a social media pot-stirrer was awarded a $376k role
items.description: The man picked for one of the Northern Territory's most lucrative jobs — which comes with a manor overlooking Darwin Harbour — has drawn controversy before even walking through the gates.

items.title: Rural council decides 'flanno' fashion is fine as business attire
items.description: Flannelette shirts might not be acceptable in every office, but after a lengthy discussion councillors in one NSW town will be allowed to wear them to meetings.

items.title: Manhunt for alleged triple murderer in regional NSW enters third day
items.description: A gunman accused of killing three people and seriously injuring another in New South Wales' Central West may be receiving help to evade authorities, police say.

items.title: Body of French diver missing in Antarctica found after lengthy search
items.description: The body of a French diver who went missing in Antarctica earlier this month has been found after an extensive multinational search, the French Polar Institute says.

items.title: Live: Early start to beat heatwave in Melbourne, as Sinner, Djokovic, Osaka set for centre court
items.description: As Melbourne braces for heatwave conditions, day seven of the Australian Open has an early start to maximise play before temperatures peak, as Jannik Sinner, Novak Djokovic and Naomi Osaka feature in matches on centre court. Follow live.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Luana intensifies off northern Western Australia
items.description: Residents in WA's West Kimberley are being warned to prepare for days of wild weather, with a tropical cyclone forming up off the region's coast.

items.title: Anxious wait continues for families as NZ landslide search enters third day
items.description: Authorities have vowed to continue searching for those missing in the disaster, as officials announce an official review into the incident.

items.title: US sends copycat drones to the Middle East to 'flip script' on Iran
items.description: The US copied Iran's Shahed 136 drone. Now, as Donald Trump threatens military action against the regime, analysts say the US could soon use Iran's weapons technology against it.

items.title: Ex-Olympian charged with murder, drug offences, as FBI likens him to Pablo Escobar
items.description: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has been charged with drug trafficking, multiple murders, and has been linked to Mexico's Sinaloa Cartel.

items.title: Live: triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025 is here, but who will be #1?
items.description: Music lovers from across the country and the world have cast their votes in the millions; but which song will be crowned #1 in the triple j Hottest 100 of 2025.

items.title: Harbour swimming warning as NSW beaches open after shark attacks
items.description: Heatwave conditions and Australia Day long weekend activities are expected to draw crowds back to the water after a dangerous 48 hours on the New South Wales coast.

items.title: Soaring temperatures in SA force Tour Down Under changes
items.description: South Australia's hottest weather in six years creates dangerous bushfire conditions, which the head of the Country Fire Service says are "as serious as it gets".

items.title: These maps show why the US is obsessed with Greenland and its Arctic neighbours
items.description: After a week of escalating rhetoric over Greenland, Donald Trump says he has now secured "total access" to the Arctic island. This is why that region is so important.

items.title: Backpacker bitten by dingoes before death but drowning likely fatal cause, coroner says
items.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds that while Piper James was bitten by dingoes before she died on K'gari, drowning is the most likely cause of death.

items.title: Future of Canberra's Black Mountain Tower in limbo as Ngunnawal cultural site plans stall
items.description: Custodians say they have been excluded from talks between Telstra and the ACT government about plans to develop the iconic tower into a Ngunnawal cultural site.

items.title: Steve Smith delivers again as Sixers cruise into BBL decider
items.description: Steve Smith top scores for the fifth time in as many innings as the Sixers down the Hurricanes to book a place in Sunday's BBL decider in Perth.

items.title: Aussie Under-19s finish World Cup group stage unbeaten with record win
items.description: Australia have continued their dominant run through the Under-19s Cricket World Cup with Will Byrom's 5-14 leading the way in a nine-wicket win over Sri Lanka in their final group match.

items.title: Crown-of-thorns starfish outbreak on Great Barrier Reef could be worst in decades
items.description: Scientists are rushing to contain an emerging outbreak of coral-eating crown-of-thorns starfish on the Great Barrier Reef, warning it could be one of the worst in 60 years.
